verses.verse: And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>, Depart<WH3212>, and go up<WH5927> here<WH5971>, you and the people which you have brought up<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, unto the land<WH776> which I swore<WH7650> unto Abraham<WH85>, to Isaac<WH3327>, and to Jacob<WH3290>, saying<WH559>, Unto your seed<WH2233> will I give it<WH5414>:

And I will send<WH7971> an angel<WH4397> before<WH6440> you and I will drive out<WH1644> the Canaanite<WH3669>, the Amorite<WH567>, and the Hittite<WH2850>, and the Perizzite<WH6522>, the Hivite<WH2340>, and the Jebusite<WH2983>:

Unto a land<WH776> flowing<WH2100> with milk<WH2461> and honey<WH1706>: for I will not go up<WH5927> in the middle<WH7130> of you for you are a stiffnecked<WH7186> people<WH5971>: lest I consume<WH3615> you in the way<WH1870>.
And when the people<WH5971> heard<WH8085> these evil<WH7451> news<WH1697>, they mourned<WH56>: and no man<WH376> did put<WH7896> on him his jewelry<WH5716>.

For the Lord<WH3068> had said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Say<WH559> unto the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, You are a stiffnecked<WH7186> people<WH5971>: If I were to come up<WH5927> into the middle<WH7130> of you in a<WH259> moment<WH7281>, I would consume<WH3615> you<WH3381>: therefore now put off your jewelry<WH5716> from you<WH3045>, that I may know what to do unto you<WH6213>.
And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> stripped<WH5337> themselves of their jewelry<WH5716> by the mountain<WH2022> Horeb<WH2722>.

And Moses<WH4872> took<WH3947> the tabernacle<WH168>, and pitched<WH5186> it outside<WH2351> the camp<WH4264>, afar off<WH7368> from the camp<WH4264>, and called<WH7121> it the Tabernacle<WH168> of the congregation<WH4150>. And it came to pass<WH1245>, that every one which sought the Lord<WH3068> went out<WH3318> unto the tabernacle<WH168> of the congregation<WH4150>, which was outside<WH2351> the camp<WH4264>.

And it came to pass<WH4872>, when Moses went out<WH3318> unto the tabernacle<WH168>, that all the people<WH5971> rose up<WH6965>, and stood<WH5324> every man<WH376> at his tent<WH168> door<WH6607>, and looked<WH5027> after<WH310> Moses<WH4872>, until he was gone<WH935> into the tabernacle<WH168>.

And it came to pass<WH4872>, as Moses entered<WH935> into the tabernacle<WH168>, the cloudy<WH6051> pillar<WH5982> descended<WH3381>, and stood<WH5975> at the door<WH6607> of the tabernacle<WH168>, and the Lord talked<WH1696> with Moses<WH4872>.

And all the people<WH5971> saw<WH7200> the cloudy<WH6051> pillar<WH5982> stand<WH5975> at the tabernacle<WH168> door<WH6607>: and all the people<WH5971> rose up<WH6965> and worshiped<WH7812>, every man<WH376> in his tent<WH168> door<WH6607>.

And the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872> face<WH6440> to face<WH6440>, as a man<WH376> speaks<WH1696> unto his friend<WH7453>. And he turned again<WH7725> into the camp<WH4264>: but his servant<WH8334> Joshua<WH3091>, the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>, a young man<WH5288>, departed<WH4185> not out<WH8432> of the tabernacle<WH168>.

And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto the Lord<WH3068>, See<WH7200>, you sayest<WH559> unto me<WH5927>, Bring up this people<WH5971>: and you have not let me know<WH3045> whom you will send<WH7971> with me<WH559>. Yet you have said, I know<WH3045> you by name<WH8034>, and you have also found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in my sight<WH5869>.

Now therefore<WH4672>, I pray you, if I have found grace<WH2580> in your sight<WH5869>, show<WH3045> me now your way<WH1870>, that I may know<WH3045> you<WH4672>, that I may find grace<WH2580> in your sight<WH5869>: and consider<WH7200> that this nation<WH1471> is your people<WH5971>.
And he said<WH559>, My presence<WH6440> shall go<WH3212> with you<WH5117>, and I will give you rest.
And he said<WH559> unto him<WH6440>, If your presence go<WH1980> not with me<WH5927>, carry us not up here.

For where shall it be known<WH3045> here<WH645> that I and your people<WH5971> have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in your sight<WH5869>? is it not in that you go<WH3212> with us<WH6395>? so shall we be separated, I and your people<WH5971>, from all the people<WH5971> that are upon the face<WH6440> of the earth<WH127>.

And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, I will do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697> also that you have spoken<WH1696>: for you have found<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in my sight<WH5869>, and I know<WH3045> you by name<WH8034>.
And he said<WH559>, I beg you<WH4994>, show<WH7200> me your glory<WH3519>.

And he said<WH559>, I will make all my goodness<WH2898> pass<WH5674> before you<WH7121>, and I will proclaim the name<WH8034> of the Lord<WH3068> before<WH6440> you and will be gracious<WH2603> to whom I will be gracious<WH2603>, and will show mercy<WH7355> on whom I will show mercy<WH7355>.
And he said<WH559>, You can<WH3201> not see<WH7200> my face<WH6440>: for there shall no man<WH120> see<WH7200> me<WH2425>, and live.
And the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559>, Behold<WH4725>, there is a place by me<WH5324>, and you shall stand upon a rock<WH6697>:

And it shall come to pass<WH3519>, while my glory passes by<WH5674>, that I will put<WH7760> you in a cleft<WH5366> of the rock<WH6697>, and will cover<WH5526> you with my hand<WH3709> while<WH5704> I pass by<WH5674>:
And I will take<WH5493> away my hand<WH3709>, and you shall see<WH7200> my back parts<WH268>: but my face<WH6440> shall not be seen<WH7200>.
